title: Dreamer

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value:
- You start the game with an estranged lover. You know their role, but they don't know yours.
- They don't know you.

- After 3 nights, your Destiny is no longer to win with your lover, but to see your lover die.
- If your lover dies before night 4, you die out of grief.
- When you fulfill your destiny, you leave the town in victory.
- **__Part of the Daily Streak faction__**
- If part of the Daily Streak faction, loses its Destiny and instead wins with Daily Streaks. Additionally, when your lover dies after night 4, choose 3 players to deal a basic attack to.

fields.name: Destiny:
fields.value: Win with your lover before night 4.

fields.name: Goal:
fields.value: Have each living Peasant fulfill their Destiny

desc:
Post 4659
*Three knocks on the door. I looked through the peephole and my eyes lit up. Something was off, though. He didn’t run in with a warm smile, like the Grand I once knew. He looked like he was somewhere else, far away. I tried to hug him, and he flinched and pushed me away. I was so scared he was losing his memory, but he remembered me. He just didn’t see the same. One day, he left and didn't tell me where to.*

*Two months later, an older woman dressed in a black came to my door. When she raised her head, I saw it was Grand’s mother. She spoke before I had any time to ask about him.*

*“Grand,” her voice wavered, “he’s passed on.” She stood outside my door teary-eyed and told me about the soldiers who came by her house that morning with bad news. I was the first guy she wanted to tell.*

*And I didn’t know how to react. Whether I was happy or sad that he was gone. So I sat on the floor and drew him. I drew him laughing and smiling, trying to teach me basketball, sitting on the couch curled around me. It eased the pain, to draw the man I once knew, and forget the one who came knocking at my door.*
